entry.title: How to get Water Chestnuts in Fields of Mistria
entry.summary:
Water Chestnuts, a key resource in the early stages of Fields of Mistria, offer significant benefits. They are not only part of Requests but also provide valuable stamina boosts. This guide will demonstrate how to obtain Water Chestnuts in Fields of Mistria and detail their versatile uses.
Where to find Water Chestnuts in Fields of Mistria
You can get Water Chestnuts in Fields of Mistria by the edge of the water at the Narrows. The Narrows are to the left of the main Mistria location, on the same pathway as the Museum and Mines. The Water Chestnuts primarily spawn in the river at the bottom.
Screenshot by Destructoid
To harvest Water Chestnuts, look for small green sprouts in the water and approach them closely. Alternatively, you can jump into the river and swim around to collect them more efficiently.
Screenshot by Destructoid
You'll find a plentiful supply of Water Chestnuts in the river, making it easy to complete missions like Request for Water Chestnuts. Additionally, this ingredient can be combined with Wild Berries to make the Trail Mix recipe, a meal that's perfect for newcomers. It replenishes health and stamina by 12, which will undoubtedly be helpful when you're stuck in the mines. Fortunately, the Wild Berries are much easier to find, as they can be picked from bushes throughout the map.
To collect more Water Chestnuts in Fields of Mistria, you'll need to wait for them to respawn near the bridge. The chestnuts should be replenished daily, so keep checking on them in the Narrows.

entry.title: How to get Shards in Fields of Mistria
entry.summary:
If you've begun the Shards Request mission, you'll likely be puzzled by the resource's mysterious locations. They aren't exactly out in the open like other items, given that they must be unearthed with specific tools. So, if you want to complete the quest and earn crafting materials, here's how to get Shards in Fields of Mistria.
Where to find Shards and Dig Sites in Fields of Mistria
Use your shovel on a Dig Site to get Shards in the Fields of Mistria. If you haven't obtained this tool yet, the General Store sells a Worn Shovel for 500 Tesserae. I've had the most luck finding the Shards at the Western Ruins site, located to the left of the Narrows.
Screenshot by Destructoid
Go to the south side of the Western Ruins to find an archeology area. You should see a dig spot where you'll need to use your shovel. However, keep in mind that Shards don't always drop, and you may end up with another item instead.
Screenshot by Destructoid
One Dig Site will spawn at the Western Ruins daily, so check back on this destination for more Shards. If you want to increase the digging spots there, speak to Caldarus (the dragon statue) and unlock the Western Ruins Scholar perk. It will spawn an additional spot to farm more resources.
Shards may appear in other areas, like the mines, whenever there's a Dig Site to uncover. I haven't had much luck outside of the Western Ruins, but it could still be possible. The material can also be used for crafting, along with the Shards Request. I suggest saving some for yourself for a future build in case it's needed again.

After two open beta tests in recent weeks, the upcoming football video game UFL has an official release date and is available for pre-order on consoles.
The game has been in development for several years and finally looks set for the official launch. While all game modes will be available for free, you can pre-order starter bundles, which have several benefits and early access.

All UFL pre-order bundles

entry.title: Review: One Piece Odyssey (Switch) - A Safe But Solid Caper For The Straw Hats
entry.summary: Here be dragons. A couple of years ago, it was notable when the Switch remakes of Pokemon Diamond and Pearl were developed not in-house by Game Freak, but by a smaller Japanese support studio called ILCA. That remake project was actually ILCA’s first crack at being the lead developer on a game, and it soon followed this up early last year with One Piece Odyssey, an original JRPG based on the long-running franchise about wacky pirates. Now this release has finally made its way over to the Switch, and we’re happy to report that it’s made the jump almost entirely intact. Though it’s taken a bit of a visual hit, One Piece Odyssey still proves to be an enjoyable and accessible release that's a welcome addition to the Switch’s considerable RPG library. The narrative in One Piece Odyssey is a sort of ‘bottle episode’ that follows the adventures of the Straw Hat Pirates crew after they shipwreck upon a mysterious island called Waford. Shortly after arriving, a mysterious figure takes away their power (cutely represented by everyone dropping from level 40 down to 1) and locks it away in various magical cubes scattered across the island. Even when they recover some of the cubes, the only way they can unlock the power contained within is through diving into illusory worlds crafted from their memories and reconquering trials they once faced, although events play out a little differently this time around because of how ‘fuzzy’ memory can be. The crew thus sets out through worlds based on the memories of some of their greatest struggles to reclaim their power and get to the bottom of what’s going on with this strange island. entry.title: Virtuální Bastlírna vol. 41: Kosmické novinky
entry.summary:
Horka polevila, ale žár nadšení Strahováků z techniky nepolevuje! Za poslední měsíc se stalo několik událostí doslova kosmického charakteru. Došlo k úspěšnému startu a vypuštění sond z rakety Ariane 6, Boeing vyslal Starliner na oběžnou dráhu, kde nyní jeho pasažéři neplánovaně už druhý měsíc setrvávají. KiCAD má novou verzi a blíží se konference k jeho dalšímu vývoji. Objevil se nový čip kombinující RP2040 s ethernetem a povedlo se na čipu vytvořit pulzní safírové lasery. Jsou vám tyto novinky málo? Pak jsou na Virtuální Bastlírnu připravená i obecnější hardwarová témata!
Za HW lze probrat zajímavé nově objevené parazitní jevy v SiC MOSFETech, jak se dá operační zesilovač "zaseknout" nebo k čemu jsou dobré ztrátové koaxiální kabely a kde je sehnat. Samozřejmě bastlíři narazili i na kuriozity, například doutnavkovou logiku nebo plošňák, jehož součástí je ohýbačka na THT součástky.
Software ani tentokrát nezůstane stranou - kromě již zmíněné nové verze KiCADu se dá podívat na stavbu linuxového managovaného switche, NanoKVM, převod videa z DisplayPortu na eink nebo emulátor NESu na Picopadu.
Jak je zvykem, s postupem večera se jistě přejde i k lehce bizarním tématům - kupříkladu, co provedl CrowdStrike, jak zprovoznit Doom na erotických hračkách pro pány, jak vypadá nestandardní 12V USB nebo jak se ztrácí některé části audio záznamů z CD, protože je většina SW neumí správně přečíst.
Příští Virtuální Bastlírna se pod taktovkou projektu MacGyver studentského klubu SiliconHill bude konat ve středu 7. srpna od 20:00 minimálně do 22:00 (ale obvykle končí o dost později). Odkaz na konferenci se před samotnou akcí objeví na bastlířské wiki.

entry.title: Tachyon Dreams Anthology review: '80s-inspired space questing that channels Sierra's heyday
entry.summary: In the heyday of Sierra's adventure game years, there was a series called Space Quest that featured an intergalactic janitor named Roger Wilco. The series was more satirical than King's Quest, less preachy than Police Quest, and not quite as adult as Leisure Suit Larry. Spearheaded by Scott Murphy and Mark Crowe - a pair of devs who called themselves "Two Guys from Andromeda" - Space Quest was renowned for its humour, and there was a nice sense of progression throughout most of the series, with Roger Wilco leveling up from working class spaceman to the head of his own Star Trek ship. entry.title: Cataclismo is not about protecting your towns, it’s about protecting your beautiful staircases
entry.summary: Between Against The Storms’ critters, Manor Lords’s perfect oxen, and now Cataclismo, Hooded Horse’s roster of strategy games share a common thread that many guard-the-village-em-ups can fatally overlook: they present a civilisation that’s worth protecting. Even if the fallen culture you’ll defend against waves of gribblies offers fascinatingly few concrete details on its origins, there’s a lithe and impressionistic otherworldliness and use of colour in Cataclismo’s art that evokes unearthed layers of history. Also, everyone is just so gosh darn likeable, with their foppish hats plopped atop stretched bodies, and dialogue that remains resolute, chirpy, and eager, even when you’re click-marching these poor folk straight to their deaths. Still, none of this will stop me will sacrificing every last man, woman, and child of these beleaguered warriors if it means preserving a single one of my immaculately crafted staircases. Read more
